company

Class Schedule

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • company.Schedule

  • public class Schedule
extends java.util.Observable
    Represents the schedule of the company. Contains a list of pending orders, the current time and algorithms for scheduling the pending orders.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Schedule()
      creates new schedule with an empty list of carOrders and a current time at the beginning of the first day.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SchedulingAlgorithm getCurrentAlgorithm() 
      TimeStamp getCurrentTime() 
      TimeStamp getETA(Order order) 
      java.util.List<Order> getFinishedOrders() 
      Order getNextOrder(int time)
      Returns the next order that is scheduled to start assembly and removes it from the pending orders.
      int getNumberOfOperationalDays() 
      java.util.List<Order> getPendingOrders() 
      boolean isOutOfOrders() 
      boolean nextIsTomorrow() 
      void placeOrder(Order order)
      adds given order to the list of pending orders and updates the schedule.
      void setAlgorithm(SchedulingAlgorithm algorithm)
      sets the scheduling algorithm to the given algorithm.

      • Methods inherited from class java.util.Observable

        addObserver, countObservers, deleteObserver, deleteObservers, hasChanged, notifyObservers, notifyObservers

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Schedule

        public Schedule()
        creates new schedule with an empty list of carOrders and a current time at the beginning of the first day. The schedule uses the FIFO scheduling algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentTime

        public TimeStamp getCurrentTime()
        Returns:
        the current time

      • placeOrder

        public void placeOrder(Order order)
        adds given order to the list of pending orders and updates the schedule. Estimated completion time will be set in order.

      • getNextOrder

        public Order getNextOrder(int time)
        Returns the next order that is scheduled to start assembly and removes it from the pending orders. This method should therefore only be called when the assemblyLine advances.
        Parameters:
        time - The time the previous cycle on the assemblyLine took.
        Returns:
        the next order to be assembled, or null if there are no more orders planned for today or if there are no more pending orders.

      • getPendingOrders

        public java.util.List<Order> getPendingOrders()
        Returns:
        All pending orders, in the order they were placed.

      • getFinishedOrders

        public java.util.List<Order> getFinishedOrders()
        Returns:
        All finished orders, in the order they were completed.

      • getCurrentAlgorithm

        public SchedulingAlgorithm getCurrentAlgorithm()
        Returns:
        the currently used scheduling algorithm.

      • setAlgorithm

        public void setAlgorithm(SchedulingAlgorithm algorithm)
        sets the scheduling algorithm to the given algorithm.

      • getETA

        public TimeStamp getETA(Order order)
        Returns:
        estimated completion time of the given order, or null if the given order is not present in the list of pending orders of this schedule.

      • nextIsTomorrow

        public boolean nextIsTomorrow()
        Returns:
        true if the next scheduled order is scheduled for tomorrow. If there are no orders left, returns false.

      • isOutOfOrders

        public boolean isOutOfOrders()
        Returns:
        true if there are no pending orders.

      • getNumberOfOperationalDays

        public int getNumberOfOperationalDays()
        Returns:
        the number of days that have passed since the system was initiated
